oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Claimant's application by T. S. Clevinger for Civil War damages
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Thomas S. Clevinger of Mill Springs, Jefferson County, Tenn. is filing for compensation from the US government for the loss of "commissary stores"--1258 lbs. of "super fine flour" and 15 bushels of bran--taken by officers of the 23rd Ala. Inf. Regt., CSA on December 13, 1863. These supplies were probably taken by Confederate foragers from Gen. Longstreet's command as it moved through Jefferson County after abandoning the siege of Knoxville.
